A.Q131030: operator (mapping from one vector space or module to another in mathematics)

\\mathcal{O}: space of smooth functions from \mathcal{R}^n into the field \mathcal{K} slowly increasing at infinity (with all their derivatives)
\\mathcal{O}^{(m\\mathbb{)}}: the \mathcal{O} space limited to the functions which can generate a multiplication operator of the space \mathcal{S}_{n} into the space \mathcal{S}_{n} itself

title: Reversal Context 1
comments: important: dont know what n and m are for. I assume \mathcal{L} is Lagrangian density, but I have no idea really
